intro: Acronema, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Europe and western Asia. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Acronema species produce small, greenish or white flowers arranged in clusters. They are generally herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, shady environments.
